phishnoob.subject: Re: liberal definitions
phishnoob.greeting: Hello John Hall and FoRK team,
phishnoob.body: Per John Hall's statement, "The opinion that EITHER we are spending too much OR we have too much regulation is pretty much anathema to liberal politics," I respectfully disagree. It is essential to acknowledge that liberal beliefs encompass a diverse range of perspectives and are not limited to a singular viewpoint.
phishnoob.call_to_action: Let us continue this dialogue with mutual respect and a commitment to fostering a culture of inclusivity and intellectual exchange. Your perspectives are valuable and contribute to the enrichment of our collective knowledge.

phishnoob.topic: Urgent: Closure of Department of Linguistics at SOAS
phishnoob.subject: Save Our Linguistics Department!
phishnoob.body: It is with great dismay that we inform you of the imminent threat facing the Department of Linguistics at the School of Oriental and African Studies (SOAS) in London. The department, which boasts a rich history and renowned scholars, is at risk of closure due to severe budget cuts. This decision was made without any prior consultation with the faculty, leaving us in a state of shock and disbelief.
phishnoob.call_to_action: Let's stand together to save our linguistics department! üìù‚úâÔ∏è

phishnoob.subject: Seeking Phoneme Bigram Frequency Data
phishnoob.body: I am new to this list and currently conducting research on speech comprehension, focusing on prosody and word boundary detection at York University's Psychology Department. I am in need of assistance with obtaining a list of phoneme bigram (and possibly trigram) frequencies in the English language. Unfortunately, all the counts I have come across are for letter bigrams, not phonemes. If anyone has access to this specific data or can point me in the right direction, I would greatly appreciate it.
phishnoob.call_to_action: Any help or guidance on locating phoneme bigram frequency data would be immensely valuable to my research. Thank you in advance for any assistance you can provide.

phishdisciple.subject: Re: Recent Publication Dispute
phishdisciple.body: I am writing in response to recent events regarding a publication dispute that has arisen in the academic community. It has come to my attention that a paper was accepted for publication in which I was personally attacked and misrepresented based on alleged oral remarks made during a conference. I believe that scholarly criticism should be based on published statements that can be verified, rather than on unverifiable oral discussions. This type of critique not only has a negative impact on academic discourse but also undermines the integrity of scholarly publications.
phishdisciple.call_to_action: I urge for a reconsideration of the decision to publish the paper in question and request an opportunity to provide a rebuttal to address the inaccuracies and misrepresentations. It is essential for academic integrity that all parties involved have the chance to respond and engage in a constructive dialogue.

phishdisciple.topic: Availability of Experimental Machine Translation System Software
phishdisciple.sender_persona: Technical University of Berlin Research Team
phishdisciple.subject: Information on Experimental MT System Software
phishdisciple.body: We are excited to announce that the experimental machine translation (MT) system software developed by the Project KIT-FAST from the Technical University of Berlin is now available for access via both the World Wide Web (WWW) and FTP. The software is implemented in Prolog and is compatible with both PC and Sun workstations. For more information and to access the software, documentation, and related resources, please visit the following link: http://www.cs.tu-berlin.de/~ww/mtsystem.html üåê
phishdisciple.call_to_action: Visit our website to access the experimental MT system software and related resources.

phishmaster.topic: Positive experience with Via mini-itx boards/Via C3 processors
phishmaster.subject: Share Your Experience with Via mini-itx boards/Via C3 processors
phishmaster.body: Recently, I came across an interesting project involving the use of Via mini-itx boards in creating a humidor. This got me thinking about the overall performance and reliability of Via mini-itx boards and Via C3 processors. I personally have been using a laptop with a Via C3 processor running Debian with a self-compiled 2.4.19 kernel, and I must say that my experience has been extremely positive. The chip has performed flawlessly, and I have encountered no issues whatsoever. In fact, I have found it to be quite efficient and reliable.
phishmaster.call_to_action: Share your experience with Via mini-itx boards/Via C3 processors in the comments below!
